profile.description: The profile object to use, including name, prompts, and examples

minecraft_version.description: The version of Minecraft to use

host.description: The minecraft server host address to connect to

port.description: The minecraft server port to connect to

base_profile.description: Allowed values: survival, creative, god_mode. Each has fine tuned settings for different game modes.

load_memory.description: Whether to load bot's previous memory

init_message.description: The initial message to send to the bot
init_message.default: Respond with hello world and your name

only_chat_with.description: List of agents to only chat with. If empty, the bot will chat publicly

speak.description: Whether to enable text-to-speech reading on the host machine

language.description: The language to automatically translate to and from using google translate

blocked_actions.description: List of actions that are blocked

relevant_docs_count.description: Number of relevant function documents to include in the prompt for LLM code writing

max_messages.description: Maximum number of recent messages to keep in context for LLM

num_examples.description: Number of examples to select to help prompt better LLM responses

max_commands.description: Maximum number of commands allowed in consecutive responses. -1 for no limit

narrate_behavior.description: Whether to openly chat automatic behavior like 'Picking up item!'

log_all_prompts.description: Whether to log all prompts to file. Can be very verbose.

verbose_commands.description: Whether to show full command syntax in bot responses. If false will use a shortened syntax.

chat_bot_messages.description: Whether to publicly chat messages to and from other bots

render_bot_view.description: Whether to render bot view for user observation. Does not give bot vision.

allow_insecure_coding.description: Whether to allow newAction command that let's LLM write/run code on host computer. Despite sandboxxing, it is potentially insecure.

code_timeout_mins.description: Number of minutes to allow code execution. -1 for no timeout

task.description: The task object to give the agent on start. If null, the agent will not have a task.
